What a phone is this more from my expectations great phone Given the obsession of the smartphone world with the 18:9 aspect ratio of the display Xiaomi too has incorporated this for the Redmi 5 Pro. But this isn’t the first Xiaomi phone to come with a bezel-less design in India as it had introduced this feature with its flagship device the Mi Mix 2 last year. However, with the Redmi 5 Pro, now it won’t burn a hole in your pocket. Due to the bigger display, the capacitive keys are now on-screen keys.
The front is as usual dominated by the display along with the selfie camera, earpiece and the usual array of sensors on the top edge, with a layer of 2.5D Corning Gorilla Glass on the top with rounded display corners. The curves make the phone easy to hold and facilitate smooth operation, despite sporting a 5.99-inch screen size.Turn the smartphone around and you will first see a vertically placed iPhone X like rear camera setup, where the LED flash is housed in between the two lenses. Frankly, this is not the first time when an Apple design feature has made its way to other smartphones. Remember when the dual rear camera setup of the iPhone 7 Plus was unveiled, how many handset makers got "inspired" by the design?
Moving on, the back panel also has a centrally placed fingerprint sensor and the Mi branding below it. The handset comes with a micro-USB charging port (we fail to understand why) that is placed at the bottom, along with 3.5mm audio jack and the mono speaker. There's a volume rocker and power button on the right, while the left side has a SIM card tray. The top of smartphone has the IR blaster that lets it control devices such as a TV.
Coming to the display, the Xiaomi Redmi Note 5 has a 5.99-inch screen with a FHD+ resolution of 2160x1080p. The display comes with features such as Reading mode, which reduces the blue light emissions; Schedule that lets you customize the period of this reading mode; Contrast and colour selection and text size options. The images were quite sharp and we did not see any pixelization. The sunlight legibility is not one of the best suits of the device and we also felt the display looks slightly dimmer, when viewed from a certain angle.
Overall, we can say we did not have any complaints with the slim body design and is definitely going to grab some attention, even if it’s just for the rear camera panel.
Performance and camera
Let’s talk about the specs of the device as it comes with a noteworthy feature. Debuting along with the Xiaomi Redmi 5 Pro is the Qualcomm Snapdragon 636 processor, making it the first smartphone in the world to be powered by it. This new chipset features the newest Kyro technology, claimed to be seen in the 800-series chipset. Apart from this, the Note 5 Pro has 4GB RAM and 64GB internal storage.
The device runs Xiaomi's MIUI 9 skin based on Android 7.1.1 Nougat, and should hopefully receive an Oreo-based update as all major launches of this year now are expected to come with the latest operating system. The MIUI 9, like the typical Xiaomi UI, has no app drawer and therefore all apps are placed on multiple home-screens. It comes with an app lock feature and dual apps space customized theme option. The leftmost home screen comes with quick cards that show the frequently used features and information. It is placed in the form of cards, similar to Today's page in iOS, that show shortcuts, calendar, take a note and more. This can obviously be customized as per the user and comes in quite handy once you start depending on it.
One thing that we must point out is that even though the handset has a third-party theme support, these apps are not yet optimized for the 18:9 aspect ratio of the display. There is a blank black patch that comes on the lock screen if you select any app and it surely gets on your nerves after a point. When we asked Xiaomi about this, they said, "Starting this month, all official themes from Mi India will be adapted to 18:9 aspect ratio. Also, third-party theme developers are being pushed to adopt their themes for 18:9 phones."
In short, right now you get only two native themes that are fully supporting the display.
We ran Antutu and GeekBench 4 tests on our device. While the phone scored 100031 in Antutu Benchmarks, the single-core and multi-core scores on GeekBench 4 were 1772 and 4227 respectively.
During our testing, we found the overall performance of the Xiaomi Note 5 Pro to be simply incredible. The phone handled multi-tasking of random app in a smooth lag-free way. We did not encounter any frame freezing of any kind. Both the call quality and the Audio quality are also quite good. The issue persists with the speaker placed at the bottom as the sound gets muffled when the device is placed in a landscape mode.
The Xiaomi Redmi 5 is backed by a 4000mAh battery that easily lasted us for more than a day of average use that included playing games and browsing social media apps, with Wi-Fi turned on.

AMAZING BALANCED PHONE - comparing to PRO version(Why i did not bought PRO an)
1) snapdragon 636 is untested and only 1.8Ghz however 625 is 2 Ghz and widely used in past. That is the reason MI choose that processor for it.
2) ram beyond 3gb is not needed in any apps or games in current scenario.
3) I have stopped buying storage space even 16 gb will suffice me. I already have more than 2 tb in PC. Also not a fan of keeping lot of data in phone, it makes it slow.
4) dual camera effect is rarely needed and can be done easily with softwares
5) Front camera is used generally for close up pics. Whether its 20MP or 5MP it will be almost same if quality of 5 Mp is clear enough. And this phone clicks good photos from both cameras even in low light.
6) high PPI + high CPU + gyro = Good for VR Experiance.
7) 5G is expected in 2019 and 4g phones will be history, so dont buy for long term it will go waster. I consider this phones max life is less than 2 years for me.

My point is, of course you will get better config in PRO version BUT there is not much practical use of those features. If you dont want to use gyroscope, Redmi 5a will be better choice. Dont even bother note series.

My review on the phone would be quite different as I am not typical android user, i wanted to buy "note 5 Pro" but it wasnt available so i went ahead with this one.

I got this phone and used it for 4 days now. I mostly used iphone (still use it as main phone), and havent had used Android for a very very long time (gingerbread was last version i think) - I must say Android improved a lot.

About the phone - this phone is no doubt a "every penny worth" phone at this price range - All my ratings are based on the price paid for the products - as I am not comparing it with Iphone or Blackberry Passport that I used before, obviously they were flagship of their respective brand.

Camera - Not bad, but not very good under law light (my personal opinion) - front camara is better.

Battery - I would give it 5/5 - since this is my secondary phone, i use it for extra activities - like music (couple of songs a day), games (only one game not more than 20 mins a day), fb about 15 mins a day, insta (about 10 mins a day), not too many calls. I can clearly use it for more than 2 days in single charge.

design: not very stylish - I wanted to have honor 9 lite which is far better looking - but performance wins over look - since this is more durable. I only wish that the fingerprint scanning would be at the front. But I understand this is Android, so cant have it.

handling: even thought this is 6 inch screen (almost) I can handle it with one hand in most cases. kinda like that

About android - since this is the first time, I am using after a long time - i dont know what to tell. Most people would complain about the update but frankly speaking, i dont care. As long as it work smooth and does the job. As I dont expect to use it for a very long time.

Also most importantly - most people would say - those who use iphone cant use android, as Iphone is more user friendly and secure. I dont think thats true - Of course iphone is secure and user friendly, but i think android is open source. :P

If you are looking to buy a phone under 15K, this could be your option. Thanks for reading and enjoy your phone.

This phone is a great value for money. I bought this on a flash sale and the phone was delivered to me on the very next day. Mi phones over the years have made a good name for themselves. The phones are made in India as it is written on the back of the packing. Mi note 5 has a huge 6" screen which is more than enough for people who are looking forward to use it in playing games and watching movies. If you are smart and tweak the settings of this smart phone to just the right amount, 4000 mAH battery is more than enough to last the phone for 1.5 days. Slim and metal like finish of Note 5 phones makes it feel very comfortable to hold it in the hand. I am using this device since 10 days and so here is my experience with redmi note 5..

1.camera (front 10/10 & rear */10)
Rear camera of this device is much improved as compared to other xiomi budget devices..it had good colours saturation and I am specially impressed with its performance in low light conditions.. talking about front camera it is satisfactory and clicks good pictures as am not a selfie addict so 5mp is sufficient for me..
2. Battery (100/10)
Battery of this is just extraordinary.other xioami devices are just no match for redmi note 5..!!!!!!also thanks for sd 625 processor.. i get 10-11 hrs sot regularly with heavy internet usage ..if u are a heavy user it will last easily hoto 1.5 days..
3.design (7/10)
Am not that much satisfied with its design of u look at its back side u won't recognized whether it is redmi note 5 or 4 or 3..
4.screen (10/10)
As it comes with 18:9 aspect ratio watching movies and playing games is very enjoyable.. and other smartphones feels to old in hands..
5.sound quality (9/10)
Sound in loudspeaker is adequately loud but it is not too loud but still I can say that sound is above average..and sound in earphone is also sufficiently loud..
6.gaming (10/10)
I am not that much heavy gamer but I still played wcc2 and hya sa and it ran smoothly i didn't notice any framedrops at all..!! And I also saw gaming review of this device and it is best device to play heavy games..
7.performance (9/10)
Performance of this device is very good and runs smoothly but still I noticed minor lags here and there but it is not much of concern as they are not noticeable.. u won't notice such lags every time..
8. Cellular call quality (10/10)
I used idea sim on this device and the cellular call quality was very good..


9. The only thing I didn't liked about this device is that it still comes with hybrid sim slot as they had added dedicated micro sd slot to redmi y1 so come on xioami u should have added dedicated slot to this device also..☹️☹️

Pre-installed antivirus and data cleaner.
It has a customizable user interface (Miui 9)

Cons:
Android version is Nougat (Oreo update may come in a few months)
No usb c-type port (Personally I don't really a need C-type port)
Bezels are not that small as it looks.
Decent camera. Low lighting conditions performance not good.

Verdict:
Worth the price.
Not made for hardcore users, gamers and Camera lovers.

One thing which I didn't like about the device is the rear camera bump. It will get scratches easily when the device will be placed on a table or anything like that.
I really hate the hybrid sim tray systems.
Call quality is really crisp and clear. No issue with the main loud speaker either.
Best budget phone under 10k. No other manufacturers have a device like it.. It's really an allrounder..
Don't think. Just go for it..

I hove got 3gb version @ 9k. Previously I was using 2gb version of Note 3 (cost 10k). I am giving a brief comparison.

Pros:
1. Speed: Note 5 is faster as it has better processor and more RAM .
2. Software: Software is updated in Note 5.
3. Battery: No difference found in Battery.
4. Screen: Though Note 5 has larger screen (18:9), it does not help much. YouTube and other videos play in smaller area. In Note 3 videos plays in full screen. This might be most of the videos are in 16:9 format. The same case is applied to Pictures. However in other cases, like text writing, reading, browsing etc., you will get advantage in Note 5

Cons:
1. Camera: I am very much unsatisfied with camera of Note 5. Note 3 and 5 have (16+5) mp and (12+5) camera resp. But picture quality is very bad compare to Note 3. Even selfie light does not help as the quality of camera in Note 5 is very bad.

Overall if you don't have any problem with bad quality picture you can definitely buy Note 5.

Flipkart doesn't provide the option of half-rating. I mean to rate this product as 3.5 stars.

After using it for couple of weeks I can definitely say that this phone is best in its segemnt.
Only problem is its sub-standard camera.
I am fairly happy with its battery life, screen ratio, pixel density and performance.
I can easily play heavy games without any significant lag.

Although, other con is its slippery body and protuding camera.
I do not like phone covers but in this case, having a phone cover is a necessity. Xiomi takes care of this and does provide a good quality, light weight, transparent cover but it kind of defeats the whole purpose of buying a bezel less phone.

It is almost impossible to use it without its cover without risking scratches on camera.
Screen is durable too.
I accidentally dropped my phone screen first on ground and surprisingly I couldn't find even a single scratch.

If only this phone had better back cover and less protuding camera, I would have given it 5 stars.

Good Smartphone. At first glance, you may actually feel that you are holding Redmi Note 4 and not Redmi Note 5. The smartphone shares almost identical looks as its predecessor. The similarity is all the more prominent at the rear side. The front of the smartphone has some difference to offer. The Xiaomi Redmi Note 5 is the first budget smartphone of the company to come with a bezel-less display. The device comes with a same chassis with antenna lines running across the device but the a large and bright display is its highlight.
The smartphone comes with minimal bezels on the sides and this time the smartphone also comes with a selfie light flash. The smartphone is also slightly slimmer as compared to the Redmi Note 4. The handset is appears sturdy and boasts of good build quality. In fact, it is quite solid when compared to most smartphones in the market.

Excellent value for money. No doubt about it. Battery backup is superb. It takes some effort to fully drain out the battery. Camera quality is quite good. Selfies are decent. Haven't tried low light photography yet. Sound quality is up to the mark. You need decent earphones and the device won't disappoint you. Bass is good. Got a free back cover delivered with the device itself. It fits perfectly on the phone. It's been a week since I have been using this phone. My earlier phone Lenovo K5 Plus lacked battery backup. At this Redmi Note 5 32 GB is the best phone that you can buy under Rs. 10000/- in India right now.

It's been a month since I ordered this device. I'm gonna share my views on this mobile.

PROS:
1. PROCESSOR: This mobile features a Snapdragon 625 Qualcomm 2 gHz processor which is the best in this price range. We also have a better processor in Asus Zenfone pro max which has Snapdragon 636 but it has only 1.8gHz clock speed. Hence I think both doesn't vary by a significant amount of performance.

2. DISPLAY: It has 5.9 inch full hd+ display which gives a premium look. Even minute details are crystal clear.

3. BATTERY: The Redmi note 5 definitely beats all other devices in the battery segment. I'm a hard core user, meaning I'd do things like rooting my mobile,install custom roms, keep changing my mobile features, keep experimenting new apps, watch YouTube videos for hours, play PUBG whenever I'm not doing any of the above, listen music all time in headset. I usually use my mobile throughout the day as I'm on holidays. It gave me SOT of 12-14 hours, which is the best at this price range.

4. BACK PANEL: It has a metal finish which is classy as well as protective. No worries about dropping the mobile. Not like Honor 9 lite. Front panel is of gorilla glass.

5. SOUND: The sound is good for normal users. It's sharp and clear.

CONS:
1. CAMERA: The default camera is good for normal users. But I was expecting for a good camera. The camera is almost the same as in RN4. If you have rooted mobile, I suggest you to use Google camera,which even has portrait mode which is awesome. I don't tell that the camera is worst. It's not upto my expectation. It's good for instagrammers.

2. FINGERPRINT: I don't know if this is a pro or con, the fingerprint sensor is damn fast. It's so much fast that even before you place your finger fully it detects but since it detects half finger, it ends up showing wrong fingerprint. So i must place my entire finger quickly.

3. SIM SLOT: It'd be better if we could insert 2 Sims and microsd at the same time.

OVERALL SUGGESTION:
✓ GO FOR THE PHONE WITHOUT GIVING A SECOND THOUGHT. I ASSURE YOU. YOU'RE NOT GONNA WORRY FOR BUYING THIS MOBILE. MY ENTIRE FAMILY NOW USES REDMI NOTE SERIES MOBILE AND NOT ONE HAS STOPPED WORKING. DONT THINK THIS AS A CHINA MOBILE. DONT THINK THAT SINCE MANY BUY THIS I WANNA BUY A DIFFERENT ONE. THEN YOU'LL END UP WORRYING. GO FOR REDMI NOTE 5.
✓ TRUST ME THIS IS BEAST..

Here is detailed review after using it for a week.
Was having second thoughts after ordering it via Flipkart. was getting 1000INR cheaper at Amazon.
Nevertheless I ordered it from here. On initiate usage, the phone looked and felt premium. absolutely gorgeous with the gold champagne colour. I set it up and signed in to my Google account. Everything worked like a breeze.
Trouble started when I wanted to transfer my contacts from the old phone to this one. The contacts app kept crashing. To this this I could not transfer my contacts via vCard. I had to resort to synchronizing my contacts via Google.

When it's all said and done I update and installed some apps from the Play store. Everything was fine except for the battery life.

I must say the battery depletes at a very fast rate when using the phone or even when I crank up the brightness outdoors.

Except for the battery life, everything seems to be fine with the phone.

Let's hope for the best.

Just one glitch, I was not able to send SMS from SIM 1.
So we need to do following steps to resolve it.

1. Open dialpad and enter *#*#4636#*#*

2. You will be redirected to phone info page. You will notice your SMSC input field is empty and DNS is not available 0.0.0.0 not allowed

3. Click on refresh button next to SMSC input field and SMSC number will be automatically populated.

4. Now click on update button next to SMSC input field

5. Now click on toggle DNS check and you should see 0.0.0.0 allowed

6. You are done. You should be able to send SMS now.

Thanks again to Flipkart and Redmi.

Regards,
Vishal

Pros
works like charm, consumes less battery

Cons

Lacks fast charging but still charges in 2 hrs 30 mins for 10 to 100
Should be upgraded to Android O which I feel is a downgrade on the LATEST device by Mi.
Still Low Light photos aren't a thing in Mi Phones

Final Verdict.
4/5

I am using this Redmi Note 5 for almost 15 days and to be honest I am impressed with the performance of this device. Earlier I had been using Redmi 3S prime which served me pretty well for more than 1.5 yrs and still now in very good condition but as I need a big screen so I decided to buy this Note. The main pros are :
1. Great 18:9 Display
2. Sound is not very loud but it is enough for a smartphone 3. Battery lasts almost a day (actually I was hoping that it might not last for a whole day as the display size is bigger but I was totally wrong in that case). Also the phone supports fast charging but we have to buy a fast charger from the market.
4. Simplistic design and MIUI is really smooth and easy to use plus the Mi theme store offers a huge collection of themes, wallpapers etc.
5. No heating issue. There is no lag also. Ram management is really good for this device. Maybe the snapdragon 625 processor is now old but I feel it's enough to run this device.
6. Front camera is really amazing. I am not a selfie lover but still I found that it is better than some other Samsung smartphone front camera with 10 to 15k price range.
7. Dual apps and Second Space: this was the best thing for me when I used redmi 3s prime and now this is again a 100% hit for me in this device.

The Cons are :
1. 32 GB is not enough in the storage section. We have a memory card slot but that is hybrid so if we use memory card we can't use second Sim card which is the most important drawback in this device.
2. Some high resolution games like PES, Mortal Combat crashes some time. Actually it was PES that crashed more than 10 times although The FIFA mobile runs like a charm.
3. Outdoor images are good when using back camera but indoor images are a bit hazy.

* Five stars to Flipkart for fast delivery

According to the latest figures from IDC, Xiaomi has been crowned the king of the Indian smartphone market beating the chaebol during the fourth quarter of the year 2017

The Xiaomi Note 5 is hands down a great phone. It has a powerful processor and a good camera, not just on paper but in experience as well. The FHD+ display in an 18:9 aspect ratio is an added perk.

Note 5 are powered by the Snapdragon 625 Octa-core chipset. The chipset is based on the 14 nm FinFET architecture with great thermal efficiency and battery life.
Camera:-
Note 5 has a 12MP primary camera. Though the number of pixels has been decreased, the 1.25-micron pixel size on the Note 5 helps the device to take better photos. Similarly, the Redmi Note 5 also excels in video department with 4K @30fps video recording capability.
The 12-megapixel sensor at the rear of Redmi Note 5 is quick to focus and snap images. The images captured in the well-lit environment are sharp and offers a great amount of details.

Battery:-
The Xiaomi Redmi 5 is backed by a 4000mAh battery that easily lasted us for more than a day of average use that included playing games and browsing social media apps, with Wi-Fi turned on.

The Redmi Note 5, is great value-for-money device. If your budget is under Rs 10,000, the Redmi Note 5 is the best money can buy.

Had to choose between this and the ZenFone max pro m1 but finally chose this one because of the highly positive word of mouth from its huge user base and the news of bugs in some zenfones. And i don't regret the decision.
I have already installed 3 updates within 2 months of buying. Currently i am using the MIUI 10.0.2.0 Global running on Android Oreo 8.1. Let me be clear that i am not a heavy user. So basing upon my needs i am utterly satisfied with the performance,camera and battery. There is face unlock (which is quite good) and bokeh mode for selfies if you are looking for those. The UI is stable, bugfree and had no lags during my day to day use.

Device is very thin and feels nice to hold. Design is minimalistic. Display is crisp and has gorilla glass protection. Also comes with a transparent case. So you can be a little less worried about damaging the display. Battery easily lasts 2 days for my use and can easily give 1 day with heavy usage.

The absence of dual rear cameras can be a deal-breaker for many. And some features of Android Oreo is not supported on MIUI which according to me is the only drawback of the UI.

But for casual use, there should be no complaints.
